item.title: Examining culture and heritage using technology as a tool
item.description:
The National Museum of Singapore’s new exhibit, “DigiMuse Presents,” opens on August 4th and features technologically innovative projects that combine history, art, and technology. Developed collaboratively with designers, artists, and tech companies, “DigiMuse Presents” offers visitors new ways to experience culture and heritage. This includes immersive virtual and augmented reality exhibits, artificial intelligence-powered conversations, and much more. Part of a larger initiative to promote digital innovation within the cultural sector, “DigiMuse Presents” showcases seven prototypes from the “DigiMuse Open Call” for digital art and innovation, which concluded in April...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/examining-culture-and-heritage-using-technology-as-a-tool/

item.title: Discover the enchantment of port cities at the Asian Civilisations Museum
item.description:
Source: ACM website. A view of Singapore from Mount Wallich, painted in 1856 by Percy Carpenter, is one of the pieces displayed at the Port Cities: Multicultural Emporiums of Asia, 1500–1900 exhibition. Port cities are vibrant hubs where people from diverse backgrounds converge, bringing with them a rich tapestry of goods and ideas. The special exhibition Port Cities: Multicultural Emporiums of Asia, 1500–1900 at the Asian Civilisations Museum offers a glimpse into this fascinating world through various mediums including photographs, paintings, textiles, luxury items, and everyday objects...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/discover-the-enchantment-of-port-cities-at-the-asian-civilisations-museum/
